business.headline: India, US in final talks to ease import tariffs and boost trade ties: ReportThe proposed agreement mainly focusses on the energy and agriculture sectors. One of the key elements under discussion is India's gradual reduction of crude oil imports from Russia, a move that aligns with Washington's efforts to limit global dependence on Russian energy supplies.

Samvat 2082: 15 high-conviction stock ideas amid ongoing market rallyAnalysts see higher returns ahead as Dalal Street enters Samvat 2082. Check out Choice Broking's top 15 stock picks span defence, tech, and premium consumption.

BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?The stock market was closed on Tuesday on account of Diwali and only two more holidays remain this year. One for Guru Nanank Jayanti on November 05 and the other for Christmas, December 25.

Gold, silver prices fall: Is the bullion rally ending?Gold prices have gained nearly 56% this year due to strong demand from central banks, ongoing geopolitical tensions, and rising expectations of rate cuts by major central banks.

Muhurat Trading ends in green; Cipla, Bajaj Finserv among top gainersThe BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 both closed in the green, led by gains in Cipla and Bajaj Finserv, even as mid-session profit booking trimmed early advances.

Samvat 2082: Experts see new highs, bet on domestic sectorsFor investors, Bandyopadhyay recommends focusing on domestic growth stories. "Cement, infrastructure, construction, and capital goods will lead the charge," he noted, highlighting Ultratech Cement, L&T, and Bharti Airtel as top picks.

Muhurat Trading 2025: Sensex, Nifty dip after strong opening; Infosys up 1%The BSE Sensex rose 180.76 points, or 0.21%, to 84,544.13, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 62.60 points, or 0.24%, to 25,905.75 at 1:50 pm.
How to make the most of your Diwali bonus and build long-term wealthTurn your Diwali bonus into a stepping stone for long-term financial security with these expert-backed tips.

Gold hits Rs 1.30 lakh again, silver at Rs 1.58 lakh: Buy now or wait for a dip?Gold and silver are regaining momentum amid festive demand and global uncertainty. Investors should buy with discipline, stagger purchases, and treat bullion as a long-term hedge rather than chasing short-term spikes.

Muhurat Trading today: Your quick guide to today's one-hour special sessionAs Muhurat Trading 2025 begins this afternoon, optimism runs high on Dalal Street. With Nifty near record highs and liquidity improving, experts suggest discipline, stock selection, and long-term focus.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on Diwali as Reliance, bank stocks shineThe BSE Sensex rose 0.5% to 84,363.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 0.49% to 25,851—both hitting fresh one-year highs. Over the past four sessions, the indices have climbed 2.8%, leaving them less than 2% away from their all-time highs scaled in September 2024.

China files WTO complaint against India over EV subsidies and batteriesThe Chinese Commerce Ministry has alleged that the measures by India violate several WTO obligations, including the principle of national treatment, and constitute import substitution subsidies, which are explicitly prohibited under the multi-lateral trade rules.

Muhurat Trading on October 21: Check timing, trade strategy and moreMuhurat Trading will take place on October 21 this year. The pre-open session will run from 1:30 pm to 1:45 pm, followed by the main trading window from 1:45 pm to 2:45 pm, and a closing session until 3:05 pm.

Reliance shares jump 3% after Q2 results. Should it be in your Diwali portfolio?Around 10:20 am, shares of Reliance Industries rose 3.22% to Rs 1,462.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The stock's sharp upmove added to the broader market rally on Dalal Street as sentiment turned upbeat following a string of solid earnings reports.

Diwali cheer on Dalal Street as Sensex jumps nearly 700 pointsAt around 9:23 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 673.90 points to 84,626.09, while the NSE Nifty50 surged 202.50 points to 25,912.35. Broader market indices also witnessed sharp gains, and volatility dropped, indicating strong investor confidence.

Silver prices fall after Diwali buying. Is it still a good bet?Silver has surged nearly 98% in a year, breaching Rs 2 lakh/kg in parts of India before a post-Diwali dip. But is investing in the precious metal still a good bet? With industrial demand booming and supply tightening, reports suggest silver's shine might just be getting started.

EU to hold urgent talks on European industries hit by China's rare earth curbsChina, the world's leading producer of the minerals used to make magnets crucial to the auto, electronics and defence industries, this month announced new controls on the export of rare-earth technologies.

PM's Diwali gift delivered: Nirmala Sitharaman presents GST 2.0 report cardGST Bachat Utsav: Sitharaman, addressing a press conference along with ministers Piyush Goyal and Ashwini Vaishnaw ahead of Diwali, said the GST rate cuts resulted in bumper sales of cars and electronics.

Gold prices near record high on Dhanteras: Should you buy?Gold prices have been on a relentless rally, hitting new record highs almost every day. But does this glittering streak make it the right fit for your investment portfolio this Dhanteras?

entertainment.headline: Singer-actor Rishabh Tandon dies of heart attack in Delhi, family requests privacy Actor-singer Rishabh Tandon died of a heart attack in Delhi while visiting family for Diwali, leaving fans and loved ones in shock. His family has requested privacy as they prepare for the funeral.

Priyanka-Nick's intimate Diwali celebration in New York radiates love. Pics Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas celebrated an intimate yet glamorous Diwali in New York, sharing heartwarming moments with daughter Malti Marie and family. The actor delighted fans with festive pictures, calling the celebration "full of heart and love."

Shah Rukh Khan joins Gauri's team for Diwali bash Shah Rukh Khan celebrated Diwali alongside his wife Gauri Khan's design team, drawing significant attention online. The event's images sparked widespread positive reactions, highlighting the actor's gesture and its impact.

Gigi, Bella Hadid go barefoot in matching bridesmaid looks for Alana's wedding Supermodels Gigi and Bella Hadid took on bridesmaid duties and went barefoot at their half-sister Alana Hadid's wedding to Ross Williams at their father's Los Angeles residence. The event, held on 18 October 2025, featured personal fashion choices and family reunions.

Soon to be Mrs: Actor Pavitra Punia gets engaged to businessman boyfriend, shares pics TV actor Pavitra Punia has announced her engagement to a US-based businessman, sharing dreamy beachside pictures while keeping his identity private. The post drew an outpouring of love from fans and friends, marking a fresh chapter in her life.

Kerala High Court to watch Haal on October 25 amid beef biriyani censorship row Kerala High Court will watch 'Haal' on Saturday following a challenge to CBFC's censorship demands. The filmmaker argued that deleted scenes are central to the film's theme and message.

Bollywood gushes over baby Dua: Sonam Kapoor to Priyanka Chopra, celebs shower love Bollywood is abuzz as Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh share the first clear pictures of their daughter, Dua Padukone Singh, this Diwali. The heartwarming post, celebrating their baby girl's adorable debut, drew affectionate wishes from stars across the industry.

Dhruv Vikram defends caste focus in Tamil Cinema: Important in this social climate Actor Dhruv Vikram responded to a question on Tamil cinema's frequent depiction of casteism. He highlighted the role of filmmakers like Mari Selvaraj and the relevance of the subject in Tamil Nadu.

Louis Tomlinson says he'll forever despise Logan Paul after Liam Payne chat Pop star Louis Tomlinson publicly denounces Logan Paul's interview approach with Liam Payne. Tomlinson affirms Payne's leadership role in One Direction and acknowledges grief after Payne's death.

Exclusive: AI brings back Sidhu Moosewala for Hologram tour, Ammy Virk spills secret Ammy Virk opened up on the Sidhu Moosewala hologram world tour using AI to recreate his presence. This groundbreaking project offers fans a unique way to experience Moosewala's legacy live.

Did Taylor Swift try to buy out a couple's wedding for her lucky number 13? Social media and podcasts fueled speculation that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce offered to buy a couple's wedding date for June 13, 2026 in Rhode Island. Insiders, online celebrity accounts, and venue officials have publicly refuted the claims.

Did Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce really fund the anti-Trump No Kings protest? Claims that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce funded the 'No Kings' protests have been debunked. Taylor Swift has been public about her political views and has endorsed former Vice President of the US Kamala Harris in the 2024 US Elections.

Why Mari Selvaraj's films matter in the age of reels Director Mari Selvaraj's films highlight caste atrocities and resilience in rural India. His cinema educates and provokes thought in an era dominated by fleeting social media narratives.

Shakira says it's the perfect time for Bad Bunny's Super Bowl takeover Pop star Shakira reimagines her landmark albums 'Pies Descalzos' and 'Fijacion Oral' for Spotify's Anniversary Series. The artist voices pride in Bad Bunny's Super Bowl headline performance and comments on the acceptance of Spanish-language music.

Are fans shaving their heads for Emma Stone's Bugonia screening? Fans in Los Angeles shave heads to attend early screening of sci-fi comedy 'Bugonia' starring Emma Stone. The cinema enforced a 'bald only' entry policy, with a barber on site for last-minute shaves.

Chase Infiniti, Christopher Briney, Gillian Anderson join The Julia Set Actors Chase Infiniti, Christopher Briney, Gillian Anderson and Jason Isaacs start work on 'The Julia Set' in London.  The film follows a young mathematician entering a highly competitive academic contest.

Vignesh Shivan on life, family; Love Insurance Kompany missing Diwali release Director Vignesh Shivan shared emotional reflections on love and family during Diwali. He highlighted simple happiness with loved ones amid the unexpected delay of his film 'Love Insurance Company', which was supposed to release on Diwali.

Bill Gates to discuss women's health issues in upcoming Kyunki... episode Bill Gates will make a special virtual appearance on 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' to promote maternal health. The show highlights progressive social issues including body image and ageing challenges faced by women.

Daughter Dua poses with parents Deepika and Ranveer for post with Diwali wishes Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh unveiled their daughter Dua Padukone Singh's face on social media. The trio was seen dressed in traditional attire amid Diwali festivities.

general news.headline: PM Modi's Diwali call with Trump carries strong message on Pakistan, terrorModi-Trump call: In their second phone call in as many months, PM Modi used the occasion to underscore India's firm stance against terrorism, subtly flagging New Delhi's discomfort with Washington's growing proximity to Pakistan.

One of the key elements under discussion is India's gradual reduction of crude oil imports from Russia, a move that aligns with Washington's efforts to limit global dependence on Russian energy supplies.
Tejashwi Yadav announces government jobs, Rs 30,000 salary schemes for self-help groupsGovernment jobs, Rs 30,000 monthly salary: Tejashwi Yadav announces scheme for women of self-help groups

Why protest over China-backed Teesta plan in Bangladesh is a red flag for DelhiThousands in Bangladesh's Chattogram held a massive rally demanding the implementation of the China-backed Teesta River Master Plan. However, experts say the plan involving Beijing, amid stalled water-sharing talks with India, could pose strategic risks for New Delhi due to its proximity to the sensitive Siliguri Corridor.

Pakistan's vulnerable coastline and fear of the Indian NavyDuring the 88 hours of Operation Sindoor, Pakistani warships were forced to flee their home ports in Karachi, highlighting how vulnerable the country's coastline is to Indian naval attacks and blockades.

Even top court judges get modest sedans: P Chidambaram on Lokpal BMW order rowP Chidambaram questioned the Lokpal's decision to buy BMW cars for its members, asking why public funds were being used for luxury. The move has drawn sharp criticism from opposition leaders and even former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant.

Live-in couple from Odisha found dead in Bengaluru, police suspect suicide pactA live-in couple from Odisha were found dead in their rented home in Bengaluru's Jigani area, with police suspecting a suicide pact following a quarrel over the man's drinking habit.

From promise to neglect: Bihar's model village for Mahadalits awaits changeIn 2007, the then Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government introduced the Mahadalit category, a new social grouping aimed at uplifting Bihar's most marginalised Dalit sub-castes. The move was accompanied by ambitious welfare plans, from housing to education, from sanitation to livelihood schemes meant to address historical injustices.

With India's campaign on the edge, time running out for captain Harmanpreet KaurWomen's World Cup: With India's campaign veering off track after three straight defeats, time is running out for captain Harmanpreet Kaur to rally her side and inspire a turnaround, even as their hopes of a semifinal spot remain in their own hands.

Grew up in a plural India: Zohran Mamdani takes aim at PM Modi on DiwaliZohran Mamdani, who visited several Hindu temples in Queens for the Festival of Lights, went on to say that PM Modi and his party, BJP, are rather leading India with a vision that the country "only has room for certain kinds of Indians."

China has been very rough with us: Trump defends 155% tariffs as overdue paybackDespite his remarks about wanting to be 'nice' to China, Donald Trump said that the United States had endured decades of unfair trade practices, forcing his administration to take firm corrective measures.

Cyclone likely to form over Bay of Bengal, Tamil Nadu on red alert amid heavy rainThe Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) has issued a cyclone alert and heavy rainfall warning for Tamil Nadu, prompting school and college closures across multiple districts.

Can going cash-only (and ditching UPI) help you save money?Is taking a break from UPI apps and going cash-only to curb unnecessary spending and save money a good idea? Finance experts have a lot to say.

If you're capable...: Khamenei mocks Trump amid rising 'No Kings' protests in USOn October 18, nearly 7 million people participated in the 'No Kings' protests at more than 2,700 events across all the 50 US states against Donald Trump's authoritarian tendencies and unbridled corruption.

May our democracies illuminate world with hope: PM thanks Trump for Diwali wishOn Tuesday, President Trump told reporters at the White House that he called PM Modi to wish him on Diwali, adding that they had a "great conversation" and spoke about trade.

UK-based Hindi scholar Francesca Orsini deported from India over visa violationsFrancesca Orsini was deported to Hong Kong within hours because her purpose of travel did not match her visa category. Orsini, however, told officials she had a valid five-year visa and was entering India to meet friends.

Rohit-Kohli not rusty, no need to jump the gun on them: Sitanshu KotakIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak believes that there is no need to jump the gun on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Speaking ahead of the 2nd ODI against Australia, Kotak called for patience with the senior duo.

Delhi continues to choke 2 days after Diwali as air quality remains very poorDelhi's air turned toxic a day after Diwali with major monitoring stations such as Wazirpur, Dwarka, Anand Vihar, Chandni Chowk, Najafgarh and others logging 'very poor' AQI levels.

Why India's sub-4 metre rule has run its courseIntroduced in 2006 to make cars smaller, cleaner, and more affordable, India's sub-4 metre rule now stands outdate, restricting innovation and design freedom.

Daughter Dua poses with parents Deepika and Ranveer for post with Diwali wishesDeepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh unveiled their daughter Dua Padukone Singh's face on social media. The trio was seen dressed in traditional attire amid Diwali festivities.

Viral: Couple defy warnings, climb frozen peak in Poland with 9-month-old babyConditions on Mount Rysy were treacherous, yet the couple ignored repeated warnings from guides and rescuers. With no safety equipment, their attempt at climbing the frozen peak quickly turned dangerous.

Not just fake paneer, India has an egg problem as wellIndia has an egg problem. It is also a problem that mirrors our problem of low-quality and adulterated food, particularly on quick commerce apps where prices are high and yet quality is missing.

Baseless, truth will emerge: Ex-Punjab DGP dismisses allegations in son's deathThe Panchkula police have registered a case against Akeel Akhtar's family following a complaint by a person whom the former IPS officer described as having "dirty thoughts and petty political motives."

Thamma box office Day 1: Ayushmann's film 2nd to Stree 2 in horror comedy universeAyushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' opened strong with Rs 24.25 crore on Day 1, becoming the second-best opener in Maddock's horror-comedy universe after 'Stree 2'. Despite mixed reviews, the film drew solid post-Diwali crowds.

Priyanka-Nick's intimate Diwali celebration in New York radiates love. PicsPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas celebrated an intimate yet glamorous Diwali in New York, sharing heartwarming moments with daughter Malti Marie and family. The actor delighted fans with festive pictures, calling the celebration "full of heart and love."

sports.headline: LaLiga cancels Barcelona's match in Miami after severe backlash from fans LaLiga has cancelled Barcelona's match against Villarreal, which was scheduled to take place in Miami. The move came against immense backlash from fans and pundits who complained about the disruption of schedule.

Asia Cup Trophy War: Pak Minister Naqvi Refuses to Hand Over Prize to India, BCCI Warns ICC Action This special report focuses on the continuing deadlock over the Asia Cup 2025 trophy between the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and Asian Cricket Council (ACC) President Mohsin Naqvi. The controversy ignited after Naqvi, who is also Pakistan's Interior Minister and PCB Chairman, refused to part with the trophy, instead urging 'that there be a presentation ceremony at which a BCCI officer, office bearer that is, and a participating player of the Indian team collect the trophy directly from him'. The demand came in response to a stern letter from the BCCI asking for the trophy to be sent to India. Following the refusal, the BCCI has warned it will escalate the matter to the International Cricket Council (ICC) if the trophy is not handed over.

Would be 5000 runs past Sachin Tendulkar had I debuted early: Michael Hussey Former Australia cricketer Michael Hussey believes that he would have crossed Sachin Tendulkar if he had debuted earlier in international cricket. Hussey, lovingly known as Mr. Cricket debuted for Australia at the age of 28.

Polo, family, and an Olympic dream: Inside Lance Watson's remarkable journey A third-generation polo player and one of the shining stars of the legendary Jaipur polo team, Lance Watson opens up about his journey in the sport, his love for India, and the Olympic dream he sees alongside his kids.

Rohit-Kohli not rusty, no need to jump the gun on them: Sitanshu Kotak India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak believes that there is no need to jump the gun on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Speaking ahead of the 2nd ODI against Australia, Kotak called for patience with the senior duo.

Is Harshit Rana criticised for clicks or is the scrutiny warranted? Harshit Rana's selection has sparked debate, balancing performance, perception, and patronage. At 23, he's a promising pacer in a thin Indian fast-bowling pool. Criticism is fair, but noise and nepotism claims risk overshadowing his potential.

With India's campaign on the edge, time running out for captain Harmanpreet Kaur Women's World Cup: With India's campaign veering off track after three straight defeats, time is running out for captain Harmanpreet Kaur to rally her side and inspire a turnaround, even as their hopes of a semifinal spot remain in their own hands.

South Africa knock Pakistan out in rain-hit clash, storm to top of table Women's World Cup: South Africa extended their impressive ICC Women's World Cup run, defeating Pakistan via the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern (DLS) method to climb to the top of the points table. Pakistan, meanwhile, crashed out of the semi-final race as their winless streak in Colombo continued.

Heavy rain washes out India's nets session before crucial New Zealand clash Heavy rains in Navi Mumbai on Tuesday forced India to cancel their training session ahead of Thursday's crucial Women's World Cup clash against New Zealand. With the weather and net run rate potentially playing a decisive role, India face a tense battle to secure a spot in the semifinals.

Sarfaraz may have to bat at No. 3 for Mumbai to stay in India's scheme: Sources Though omitted from the India A squads, Sarfaraz Khan's chances of returning to the Test side may depend on batting at No. 3 for Mumbai, as selectors lean on multi-skilled players to fill the middle order.

Courtois slams LaLiga over Miami match, says it distorts fairness and competitionReal Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois criticises LaLiga's decision to hold Barcelona's away match in Miami. The move has sparked protests and raised concerns about league fairness and consultation.

Bangladesh bottle it again, this time vs West Indies in rare Super Over encounterWest Indies triumphed over Bangladesh in a thrilling Super Over after a historic all-spin bowling strategy. The dramatic finish highlighted spin's growing influence and raised questions on Bangladesh's batting resilience.

Asia Cup Trophy War: BCCI vs ACC Chief, Warns of ICC EscalationThe focus of this special report is the escalating dispute between the BCCI and Asian Cricket Council (ACC) Chairman Mohsin Naqvi over the Asia Cup trophy. The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is demanding the handover of the silverware after the Indian team refused to accept it from Naqvi, who is also Pakistan's Interior Minister, following their victory. BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia told India Today, 'We have written to ACC to give the trophy to the champion team. We are awaiting a response.' The board has made it clear that if the ACC does not comply, it will escalate the matter to the International Cricket Council (ICC). This unprecedented situation has garnered support for the BCCI from the cricket boards of Sri Lanka and Afghanistan, further intensifying pressure on the ACC.

Rishabh Pant's Comeback Confirmed! To Captain India A After Injury LayoffThis special report focuses on the much-awaited return of Indian wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant to competitive cricket. 'It's been confirmed the wicketkeeper batter will be leading India A in two four-day matches against a visiting South Africa A side ahead of the much-anticipated test series between India and South Africa.' Sidelined since July this year due to a foot fracture sustained during the Anderson-Tendulkar trophy, Pant is set to captain the India A squad. The two four-day matches will be played in Bengaluru, with the first starting on October 30. This series is seen as a crucial warm-up for Pant ahead of the senior team's Test series against South Africa. He has been undergoing rehabilitation in Bengaluru and has been in contact with the medical team.

KL Rahul's nearly batted at all 11 positions: McGrath on India star's roleGlenn McGrath said that he was surprised by the constant batting spot changes for KL Rahul. McGrath said that the constant shuffling can affect Rahul's confidence.

Send a player to collect Asia Cup: Adamant Mohsin Naqvi responds to BCCI letterAsian Cricket Council (ACC) President Mohsin Naqvi has refused to hand over the Asia Cup trophy to India, despite a formal demand from the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). Instead, Naqvi, who also serves as chairman of the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), has directed the BCCI to organise a presentation ceremony in India and send a player to collect the trophy from him personally.

Lakshya Sen crashes out of French Open after humbling loss in 1st roundWorld No. 16 Lakshya Sen suffered a straight-games defeat to Ireland's Nhat Nguyen in the French Open Super 750 men's singles opening round in Paris, marking an early and unexpected exit for the Indian shuttler.

PAK vs SA: Rawalpindi hero Keshav Maharaj reveals how he outsmarted Babar AzamSouth Africa left-arm spinner Keshav Maharaj revealed how he outfoxed star Pakistan batter Babar Azam during his seven-wicket haul in the first innings of the Rawalpindi Test.

Older and wiser, Steve Smith prioritises mental freshness for Ashes 2025Smith reflects on career adjustments and mental strategies as he prepares to captain Australia in the Ashes opener, emphasising the importance of prioritisation and mental well-being.

Sturdy Stubbs keeps South Africa in game after Maharaj heroicsPakistan vs South Africa, 2nd Test Day 2: Tristan Stubbs came up with a resolute knock to help South Africa cut down on the lead in the first innings. Earlier, Keshav Maharaj took seven wickets to trigger a massive Pakistan collapse.

Short expects Hazlewood, Starc to exploit Kohli's off stump weakness in AdelaideAustralia batter Matthew Short admitted he did not attend the fast bowlers' meetings but expects the veteran pacers to once again look to exploit Virat Kohli's weakness outside off stump when India take on Australia in the second ODI at the Adelaide Oval on Thursday.

Smriti Mandhana tops Women's ODI batters list, Deepti Sharma 3rd in bowlers chartsSmriti Mandhana has widened her margin atop the ICC Women's ODI Batter Rankings following a series of strong displays at the World Cup. Key changes also see Deepti Sharma, Alyssa Healy and several others achieve new career highs.

Bayern Munich extend manager Vincent Kompany's contract till 2029Bayern Munich have extended head coach Vincent Kompany's contract by two years, keeping him at the club until 2029. The decision comes after Kompany led Bayern to the Bundesliga title in his debut season.

Keshav Maharaj scripts history with 7-wicket haul in Rawalpindi TestPakistan vs South Africa, 2nd Test: Keshav Maharaj became the first visiting spinner to take seven wickets in an innings in Rawalpindi. The left-arm spinner triggered Pakistan's dramatic collapse on Tuesday morning.

Spin storm in Dhaka: West Indies bowl full 50 overs of spin in historic featWest Indies made history by bowling only spin in their entire 50 overs in the 2nd ODI against Bangladesh in Dhaka. This bold strategy restricted Bangladesh to 213 for 7 and showcased the effectiveness of spin bowling on a slow, turning pitch.

Rizwan was not a bad ODI captain: Amir slams Pakistan board over captaincy sagaFormer pacer Mohammad Amir has criticised the Pakistan Cricket Board's decision to sack Mohammad Rizwan as ODI captain and hand the reins to left-arm pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi, a move that has raised eyebrows across cricketing circles.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
